attributes.comment:
Hi,
It is shocking that the fees are revamped and increased on a regular basis but
the backlog is getting longer and longer. The increases suggested in this
regulation are very high and will make it hard for most of the people to apply thus
losing rights to be the Citizens of the greatest country on earth. I suggest the
increase is not more than 25% if there has to be one and the backlog reduced to
a max of a few months and eventually no backlog by 2009. If USCIS is self
supporting organization, that is great but it should know that it is the only
organization not only in the US but I will bet throughtout the world to have
backlogs of years to process applications. Increases in fee for better and faster
service will have everyones support. Therefore, I am against the fee increases.
Thanks.

Aurangzeb
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Aurangzeb A. Khan
